channel.title: Allowing more RAM allocation for the JVM in Eclipse
channel.description: How can I make Eclipse handle more RAM when running? I can no longer run a client and server, as it terminates itself due to a lack of ram.. I add the -Xmx800m arguments in eclipse, but then it fails to create the JVM, i can only run the server independently, which won't due. I'm only on 5gb of RAM, and eclipse takes up quite a good portion.

item.title: Allowing more RAM allocation for the JVM in Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

t4:

where did you put the Xmx flag?

In the 2nd argument box (Forgot the name), under run configurations

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:4, topic:455842”]As much as I really hate to suggest this have you tried to do a clean install of your OS on a separate HDD to see if that helps out any? Love is right, 5GB of ram should be nothing close to eclipse. I ran eclipse on a Ubuntu machine with only 2GB of ram and a 1.3GHz (failing so it was overclocked to even reach 1.3GHz) without any issue.

The only real suggestion besides, and last resort, is to check out a fresh install. You could have lots of cluttered junk on your computer that is not needed. I am nearly ready to do a fresh install myself.[/quote]
I could possibly just start moving all my projects to the Ubuntu I have on dual boot, it’s relativity clean, if I go into my recourse manager, and shut down almost EVERYTHING, I can barely squeeze by and run it.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:3, topic:455842”]good lord

tyler… you need to do some massive work on your pc if 5gb is being drained by eclipse. I can run eclipse with 1gb ish…

-do a disk cleanup
-do a defrag
-disable/stop unneeded services ( go to purpleviper for more info )
-scan for rogue malware cause 5gb shouldn’t be giving you issues[/quote]
Its not just eclipse, just the fact that the JVM is a memory whore

Keep in mind I’m running a high memory client with the server running in eclipse, eclipse just has a low memory threshold.
